alert.note: Alert for Duplin; Lenoir (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 4:02PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Lenoir and Duplin Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 402 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Beautancus to near Kenansville to near Willard. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wallace, Warsaw, Mount Olive, Kornegay, Rose Hill, Bowdens, Beautancus, Kenansville, Albertson, Harrells, Sarecta, Faison, Magnolia, Greenevers, Pink Hill, Calypso and Teachey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for eastern North Carolina.
